text: Bain Capital, LP is an American investment company based in Boston, Massachusetts. It manages about $185 billion in assets. Founded in 1984 by partners from Bain & Company, it invests in many areas, such as private equity, venture capital, real estate, technology, and life sciences. Bain Capital has offices worldwide in North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. Since it started, Bain Capital has invested in many companies, including AMC Theatres, Burger King, Domino's Pizza, Guitar Center, HCA, Sealy, Toys "R" Us, and Warner Music Group. Bain Capital has gained attention for its business strategies, especially during co-founder Mitt Romney's 2012 presidential campaign. In 2023, Bain Capital was ranked 13th in the world by Private Equity International for its size among private equity firms. == History == Bain Capital was started in 1984 by Mitt Romney, T. Coleman Andrews III, and Eric Kriss, who worked at Bain & Company. They applied consulting ideas to investing and growing companies. Romney was the president and later CEO, and he held many roles at the firm in its early years. == References == Category:Companies based in Boston
